resources.string: I remember those old-fashioned barber shops, the ones where everyone was welcome. You could hear stories about people who made it to the top, never just a place to get your haircut, rather, filled with conversation and good memories. I spent most of my childhood in one. When life threw-out and the day would go wrong, the barber shop was a place that made me feel strong - a place where everyone shares an experience. It\'s places like this, I love the most.
32–86 Steinway St, Long Island City NY, 11103
Cash only All sales are final
Picture of BarberShop Supplies on Table
Picture of Map Location of Tonsorial barber shop
The water based pomade with a vanilla scent that started it all. Our original pomade holds and smells fresh all day, yet rinses out easily with water
An incredible water - based pomade that gives you ultimate control and superb hold for the most demanding, challenging and difficult to manage hair.
A lightweight, water - based shaping cream that adds texture to flexible, all day hold for a range of styles for easy and laid back to more defined.
Picture of working hours of Barber

Since he was 12, cutting hair was a hobby Luis enjoyed. Six years later, Luis’ found himself working alongside the most elite barbershops in the Tri-State area. His hobby quickly turned into his passion, giving him the opportunity to open up his own barbershop, in Queens. Luis envisions his barbershop becoming the finest barbershop in NYC by providing high-quality service and the best possible experience for his clients.

Born and raised in the islands of the Dominican Republic, Geraldo growing up would give haircuts to friends, families and even earned a Bachelor\'s Degree of arts. Geraldo enjoys going back to his roots in the Dominican Republic and visiting the many rivers and beaches on the island. To Geraldo, being a barber is an art form and with 23 years of experience his art speaks for itself.

Samy believes that when doing a job it should come from the heart, and with the grace of God. He was recently added to the Tonsorial LIC team and has been exceeded expectations and not a surprise with over 22 years of experience. Samy loves spending time with his family and also enjoys baseball.

At the age of 18, Justin was fresh out of High School exploring his next step in life. In a search for a job he wound up at LIC Tonsorial working as a cashier for his uncle Luis. Justin helped clean and complete tasks around the shop. As time passed by Justin would observe and learn from his uncle and fellow barbers the art of cutting hair. Not long after Justin began cutting hair and beginning his own journey as a barber. During this spare time, Justin likes to take road trips with his friends and see the beauties of nature. Justin is a big fan of his own city, and supports many local community events.
